result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin T Olivarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Psilocin(<=100g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(g)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments, while on probation or serve 30 days in the HOC. Cash bail to apply. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular payment.
Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both. Defendant to have no cash jobs, defendant MUST receive a paycheck.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.

No contact with Matthew H.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, and breathalyzers.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
AODA assessment, and satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) filed and signed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Fiorenza, Br 03, for review.  lm

Defendant Devin T Olivarez in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  
SENTENCE WITHELD, and is imposed and stayed for 6 YEARS PROBATION.  (If revoked defendant shall come before the court for a sentencing)

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3, AND CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, AND CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 5 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION TO ALL THREE COUNTS:

- Serve 1 YEAR UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction - with huber for work, meeting with agent, and treatment.  (COUNT 1 ONLY)
                           ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.***
 
- 1 YEAR, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 30 days for the first violation, 60 days for the second violation, and 9 MONTHS for the third violation. (COUNTS 2 AND 3)

- AODA assessment, and satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested at least once per month.
- Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.  Defendant to have no cash jobs, defendant MUST receive a paycheck.
- Complete 100 hours of community service at a non profit organization (total for all three counts)
- No contact with Matthew H.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, while on probation or serve 30 days in the HOC.  Cash bail to apply.  
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant Devin T Olivarez in court with attorney Susan M Roth.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty to all counts.  

AS TO COUNT 4 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 4 dismissed, and read in.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders a PSI.  Order signed and filed.

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed.  aw

Count 1:  Possession with intent to deliver controlled substance (cocaine), contrary to WI stats. sec. 961.41(1m)(cm)3, 939.50(3)(d).  A class D felony.

Count 2:  Possession with intent to deliver controlled substance (THC) contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1m)(h)2, 939.50(3)(h).  A class H felony.

Count 3:  Manufacture of controlled substance (Psilocin or Psilocybin), contrary to WI Stat. sec. 961.41(1)(g)1, 939.50(3)(g).  A class G felony.

Count 4:  Keeping a drug house, contrary to WI Stat. sec. 961.42(1), 939.50(3)(i).  A class I felony.
Court cancels no contact order.  All other conditions remain.

Defendant Devin T Olivarez in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Defense is trying to get the defendant into drug treatment court.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 6/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no weapons.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devin T Olivarez in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel requests a bail bond hearing.  Case adjourned for bail bond hearing and scheduling conference on 4/10/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
MOTION TO MODIFY THE CONDITIONS OF BAIL

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  sc  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Matthew H. after 3pm on 3/19/14 or his residence or place of employment
No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription,  Oral No Weapons Order

Defendant Devin T Olivarez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
